thread.title: Think Leslie Jones Can't Play Donald Trump? You're Wrong, Bigly.
thread.title_full: Think Leslie Jones Can't Play Donald Trump? You're Wrong, Bigly.

author: Carla Herreria
title: Think Leslie Jones Can't Play Donald Trump? You're Wrong, Bigly.
text:
Think Leslie Jones Can't Play Donald Trump? You're Wrong, Bigly. â€œItâ€™s about giving America what it wants.â€ 02/12/2017 02:07 am ET Carla   
When the world got a taste of Melissa McCarthy as White House press secretary Sean Spicer and Rosie Oâ€™Donnell floated a Steve Bannon-infused profile picture , the internet demanded an all-female cast to play   on â€œSaturday Night Live.â€ 
But the internet probably didnâ€™t expect a Leslie Jones masterpiece. 
â€œI never dreamed I could play the president,â€ Jones says during a behind-the-scenes style skit that aired Saturday night. â€œBut then Melissa played Spicer and I was like, â€˜Yo, why canâ€™t I play Trump?â€™â€ That moment when you've finally found your calling. @Lesdoggg #SNL pic.twitter.com/Y7Unmw5NVV   
As seen in the video above, Jones trained with determination to be the next orange-glazed POTUS â€• golden toupee, eyebrows and all. 
The impersonation, Jones warns her cast mates, is not a jab at Trumpâ€™s â€œfragile masculinityâ€ and it isnâ€™t a commentary on race and politics. 
Jones says with certainty: â€œItâ€™s about giving America what it wants.â€ 
Things, however, donâ€™t turn out as planned. Just a professional disagreement between Lorne and @Lesdoggg about whether she should play Trump on #SNL . pic.twitter.com/yZFyqFTfip   
Trump has dutifully expressed his loathing for â€œSNL,â€ especially since theyâ€™ve doubled down on POTUS since he took office, but reports this week revealed that he may have been most peeved that McCarthy, a woman, played Spicer on last weekâ€™s episode. 
Now, with Jones attempting her own version of the Donald, the world awaits a reaction from the Commander in Chief. . @Lesdoggg just took one for the team.
